verses.verse: {Davidic} {A Song for God's Provision} d Blessed be the Lord , my rock, who trains my hands for battle and my fingers for warfare,

he is my gracious love and my fortress, my strong tower and my deliverer, my shield and the one in whom I find refuge, who subdues {So LXX; the Heb. lacks subdues} peoples {So DSS 11QPs a Sebir Aquila Syr Targ Hieronymus; cf. Psa 18:48; 2 Sam 22:48; LXX reads subdues my people} under me.
Lord , what are human beings, that you should care about them, or mortal man, that you should think about him?
The human person is a mere empty breath; his days are like a fading shadow.
Bow your heavens, Lord , and descend; {So MT (imperfect verb); LXX, DSS 11QPs a read and descend! ; i. e. a verb of command} touch the mountains, and they will smolder.
Send forth lightning and scatter the enemy, {Lit. scatter them} shoot your arrows and confuse them.
Reach down your hand from your high place; rescue me and deliver me from mighty waters, from the control of foreigners. {Lit. the hand of the sons of strangers}
Their mouths speak lies, and their right hand deceives, {I. e. they swear to false oaths}
God, I will sing a new song to you. On a harp of ten strings I will play to you
to you who gives victory to kings, rescuing his servant David from cruel swords.
Rescue me and deliver me from the control of foreigners, {Lit. the hand of the sons of strangers} whose mouths speak lies, and whose right hand deceives. {I. e. they swear to false oaths}
May our sons in their youth be like full-grown plants, and our daughters like pillars destined to decorate a palace.
May our granaries be filled, storing produce in abundance; may our sheep bring forth thousands, even tens of thousands in our fields.
May our cattle grow heavy with young, with no damage or loss. May there be no cry of anguish in our streets!
Happy are the people to whom these things come; happy are the people whose God is the Lord .
